de.must.markup
Class MustButton

java.lang.Object
  de.must.markup.MustInputField
      de.must.markup.MustButton
All Implemented Interfaces:
Markupable
Direct Known Subclasses:
BackButton, CancelButton, OkButton, SearchButton
public class MustButton
extends MustInputField

Button. By default, the type is "submit". In this case, the button may be asked wasPressed() after fetchYourValueFromRequest() was executed. This is done best by an instance of GroupOfMarkupables.

See Also:
GroupOfMarkupables

MustButton

public MustButton(java.lang.String label,
                  java.lang.String name,
                  java.lang.String onClickScriptlet)
Constructs a new button for a scriptlet to be executed instead of a submit. Scriplet buttons cannot support wasPressed().

Parameters:
label - the labe to be seen by the user
name - the name of the button - using # at the end of the name causes sequential instance numbers
onClickScriptlet - the scriptlet to be executed (JavaScript) - if this parameter is not null, the button type is 'button', not 'submit'.
Method Detail

setConfirmationText

public void setConfirmationText(java.lang.String confirmationText)
Activates the JavaScript confirmation function and sets the confirmation text. Sets the button type implicitly to 'button' instead of 'submit'. Needs access to JavaScript function confirmedAction(confirmationText,actionParameterValue) and a hidden field named "actionparm" 

 function confirmedAction(confirmationText,actionParameterValue) {
   if (confirm(confirmationText)) {
     document.formname.actionparm.value = actionParameterValue;
     document.formname.submit();
   }
 }
 ...
 

 ...

Parameters:
confirmationText - The text to be displayed to confirm the action.

setSpecialPressedCondition

public void setSpecialPressedCondition(java.lang.String specialPressedConditionParameterName,
                                       java.lang.String specialPressedConditionValue)
Sets a special pressed condition - useful for additional logic in JavaScript. See constructor with onClickScriptlet

Parameters:
specialPressedConditionParameterName - then name of the parameter to be loaded to check whether the action concernes this button.
specialPressedConditionValue - the value of the parameter to indicate whether the button should be treated as pressed.

isEnabled

public boolean isEnabled()
Determines whether this button is enabled. An enabled component can respond to user input and generate events. Buttons are enabled initially by default. A component may be enabled or disabled by calling its setEnabled method.

Returns:
true if the button is enabled; false otherwise.
See Also:
setEnabled(boolean)

setEnabled

public void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
Enables or disables this button, depending on the value of the parameter enabled. An enabled button can respond to user input and generate events. Components are enabled initially by default.

Parameters:
enabled - If true, this button is enabled; otherwise this button is disabled.
See Also:
isEnabled()

fetchYourValueFromRequest

public void fetchYourValueFromRequest(GeneralizedRequest request)
Causes the component to read user input by calling request.getParameter and update the internal mirrored value.

Specified by:
fetchYourValueFromRequest in class MustInputField
Parameters:

wasPressed

public boolean wasPressed()
True if the button was pressed - auto-initialized - may be asked only once a request.

Returns:
true if the button was pressed

wasPressedWithoutInitialization

public boolean wasPressedWithoutInitialization()
True if the button was pressed - not auto-initialized - useful for previous plausibility checks - last call to the regular wasPressed recommended. a request.

Returns:
true if the button was pressed

destroy

public void destroy()
Description copied from interface: Markupable
Destroys the markupable. Useful to release e.g. static references which prevent the garbage collector from finalizing. For example HalfDataComboBoxes add themeselves as Listeners to database changes. These listeners are registered statically. Thus, these listeners cannot be removed by the garbage collector, they have to be removed manually. This may be done by calling this destroy method.

Specified by:
destroy in interface Markupable
Overrides:
destroy in class MustInputField
See Also:
Markupable.destroy()
